data.description:
Deprecated - this app is provided "As Is" and can be used, but there will be no further development or bugfixes.

a8bit is a simple 8bit retro style watch face with big numbers for good readability. It shows time and the current date (weekday / day), on wrist shake health data (sleep in the morning, steps after 2000 are reached) is shown for 3 seconds.
 
a8Bit features Clay offline configuration for:
- Color theme: CGA (Palette1), Monochrome (BW), Green, Amber, Commodore (white on blue) and Gameboy (looks more like the real thing on the watch)
- Show health as default (date on wrist shake)

CREDITS: This app uses the free "PressStart2P" font (licensed under SIL Open Fonts license http://scripts.sil.org/OFL) and the Silkscreen font (under 'Kottke Silkscreen license' http://bit.ly/2bl9SQf). Special thanks to Reno, whose Sayga watchface (http://bit.ly/2aOD16z) was an inspiration, although this is a completely independent implementation.
 
DISCLAIMER: I created this for my personal use on a Pebble Time, and I'm sharing it in the hope that it might be useful for you, too. Use at your own risk, and if you have any bug reports or suggestions let me know, I'll see what I can do.

data.description:
LastNightscout is Pebble and Pebble Time watchface designed to display latest collected data from your Nightscout diabetes management instance. This watchface is created to support use case of Abbott Freestyle Libre flash glucose monitor connected to Nightscout ecosystem. Nightscout was initially designed to support CGM systems and as such expects to gather readings continuously. For that reason it will warn you when it has not received data recently. For same reason, other Pebble watchfaces I tried were warning me when there were no recent results and some additionally refused to display "outdated" data. For that reason I created LastNightscout.
It also displays battery status and warns of disconnections.

latest_release.release_notes: First release

data.description:
This watchface is simple, non-cluttered, elegant and it is soft on the battery life by updating the screen only when it needs to.  Yet, it gives info about battery, steps and bluetooth.
For fitness, try to keep the underlining of the date green!

+The underlining of the date indicates the number of steps compared to the typical count for that time of the day. That is, a full line indicates that you are walking as much as in a typical day so far. A line that's half the length indicates that you are walking 50% of the steps of a typical day at that time. Lastly, the line turns green if you are walking more than a typical day so far.
+The watch vibrates if Bluetooth connection is lost, and the day name becomes red.
+The day number becomes red if the battery has less than 10% charge*. 
+You can configure the numbers, dots and foreground/background colors


*Since the watch itself already warns you of low battery levels, I just added this as a permanent reminder to charge the watch ASAP.

data.author: Dr. Antonio Aguilera.
data.description:
Percentages.

To quickly tell the time, just read the numbers inside the blue vertical rectangle at the top left.

Each row shows a time component as a fraction, as a colored bar, and as a percentage.
Tap or shake your Pebble to switch between percentages and simplified fractions.

This watchface handles 12hrs/24hrs format, the differences are in the title and denominator on the first row.

All four examples are at the exact same time.
Examples 1 and 2 show 16:15:30 in 24 hrs format. The title for row 1 is "H:" (for "Hours:") and the denominator is 24. Thus, 16/24 is 66.6% or 2/3 of a day.

When the 12 hrs format is active, the title "H:" is replaced for "am" or "pm" accordingly. Also, the denominator is set to 12, which means that the fraction and the percentage are with respect to just the morning (if am); or just the afternoon-night (if pm).

Examples 3 and 4 show 4:15:30 pm, now, 4/12 represents 33.3% or 1/3 of the afternoon-nigh.

The 2nd row shows that 15 min out of 60 are 25.0% or 1/4 of the hour.
The 3rd row shows that 30 sec out of 60 are 50.0% or 1/2 of a minute.
The Day of week is 2/7, this is, tuesday.
The Day of month is 9/31, i.e., the 9th day of a month with 31 days.
The Day of year is 222/366, i.e., the 222nd day of a (leap) year.
The Month is 8/12, i.e., august (2/3 of a year)
Finally, the year (2016) is not compared to anything.

If you think about it, this is quite a lot of information, which I hope you find useful, or at least interesting.

Enjoy it :)
data.title: Percentages

data.author: Dr. Antonio Aguilera.
data.description:
Jocs Olímpics
La versió original en Espanyol per: Dr. Antonio Aguilera.
Traducció al Català per: Dr. Antonio Aguilera.

Aquest rellotge mostra les hores, minuts i segons dins dels Cercles Olímpics! i baix mostra la data en el llenguatge seleccionat.

Més encara, si els segons estan entre 1 i 32, aquests representaran números d'edicions de Jocs Olímpics,
i llavors a la part superior es mostra l'any i la ciutat seu d'aquesta edició (això vol dir que ja està inclosa l'edició XXXII la seu serà Tòquio el 2020)
Si els segons estan entre 33 i 60, llavors en la part superior es mostra la seu actual: Rio de Janeiro.
El rellotge vibra si guanya o perd la connexió bluethooth.

En els exemples es mostra:
00:00:00, 12:48:31, 6:57:19 i 23:59:25.

Bono: Els Jocs Olímpics s'acosten persones i països.
A causa d'això , jo ofereixo traduir aquest watchface a la teva llengua natal, només si tu em envies per email la llista dels noms de les ciutats i la traducció completa d'aquesta descripció.
També ofereixo publicar el watchface resultant a la Botiga Pebble, juntament amb la foto de l'any i ciutat olímpica de la teva elecció (en comptes de "1968-Mèxic", la meva ciutat natal).

Jo ja vaig publicar:
(spa)Olimpiadas,
(eng)Olympics,
(cat)Olimpiades, y
(fre)Jeux Olympiques,.

i m'agradaria tenir:
(ger)Olympische Spiele, ...
(xxx)yyy   <-- el teu idioma

A canvi, jo espero que li posis un cor al meu (spa)Olimpiadas y a (xxx)yyy

Finalment, sentir-se amb la llibertat d'escriure el 3er rengle com :
Traducció a l' xxx per: (el teu nom)

Fem d'aquest un món millor!
Gaudir :)
data.title: (cat) Olimpiades

data.author: Dr. Antonio Aguilera.
data.description:
Jeux Olympiques
Version Espagnole d'origine par: Dr. Antonio Aguilera
Traduction Française par: @apebbleaday
Cette watchface indique les heures, minutes et secondes dans les Anneaux Olympiques et en dessous la date dans votre format
De plus, quand le nombre de seconde actuel est entre 01 et 32, il représentera aussi le numéro de l'édition des Jeux Olympiques correspondant, alors en haut de l'écran sera affiché l'année et la ville hôte de cette édition (ce qui veut dire que l'édition XXXII, qui se tiendra à Tokyo en 2020 est déjà inclue dans cette watchface)
Quand le nombre de secondes actuel est entre 33 et 60, alors l'année et la ville hôte actuelle sera affichée: Rio de Janeiro.
La perte ou la reconnexion bluetooth fera vibrer la montre.

Bonus: Les Jeux Olympiques rapprochent les gens et les peuples.
Pour cette raison, je propose de traduire cette watchface dans votre propre langue, à condition que vous me fournissiez par mail la liste des noms des villes et la traduction intégrale de cette description.
J'offre aussi de publier la watchface produite dans le Pebble Store, avec la capture d'écran de l'année et de la ville Olympique de votre choix (au lieu de "1968-Mexico City, ma ville).

J'ai déjà publié:
(spa)Olimpiadas
(eng)Olympics
(cat)Olimpiades
(fre)Jeux Olympiques

J'aimerais aussi avoir
(ger)Olympische Spiele, ...
(xxx)yyy <-- votre langue.

En échange, j'attends que vous aimiez ma watchface (spa)Olimpiadas et la votre (xxx)yyy.
Enfin, vous pouvez écrire la 3ème ligne de la manière suivante :
xxx traduction par: (votre nom).

Ensemble, faisons un monde meilleur!
data.title: (fre) Jeux Olympiques

data.description:
Olimpics
Original Spanish version and English translation by: Dr. Antonio Aguilera (show me my misspellings!, please)

This watchface shows the hours, minutes and seconds inside the Olympic Rings! and below shows the date in your current language.
Moreover, when the current number of seconds is between 01 and 32, then it will also represent the Olympic Game edition number, then at the top of the screen, the year and the host city for that Olympic game edition is shown (this means that edition XXXII, which will be host at Tokyo in 2020, is already included in this watchface).
When the current seconds is between 33 and 60, then at the top is shown the current host: 2016 Rio de Janeiro.

It also vibrates if it loses or gains bluetooth connectivity.

Examples show:
00:00:00, 12:48:31, 6:57:19 y 23:59:30.

Bonus: Olympic Games bring people and countries together. 
Because of this, I offer to translate this watchface to your own language, provided that you email me the city names list and the translation of this description completely.
I also offer to publish the resulting watchface in the Pebble Store, with the snapshot of the year and Olympic city of your choice (instead of "1968-Mexico City", my home).

I already published:
(spa)Olimpiadas
(eng)Olympics
(cat)Olimpiades
(fre)Jeux Olympiques

I would like to have: 
(ger)Olympische Spiele, ...
(xxx)yyy   <-- your language.

In return, I expect you to heart my (spa)Olimpiadas and your (xxx)yyy

Finally, fell free to write the 3rd row as:
xxx translation by: (your name).
Let's make a better world!
Enjoy :)

data.description:
v1.6 Adds support for Pebble 2, updates how complications display on Pebble Time Round watches, fixes several bugs, and makes some improvements to save battery life.

Eight-frame is a watchface with eight customizable complication slots. I designed it to enable quick access to data while saving swipes, clicks, and pushes. By sticking to mostly text, the watchface displays a large amount of data while limiting visual clutter. All eight complication slots can be filled or left blank as desired, and complications can be displayed multiple times.

Eight-frame has 12 weather and fitness complications, and most are self-explanatory. The exceptions:
- Wind gauge displays wind speed in mph (Imperial / UK), m/s (Metric), or km/h (Canadian), and appends the bearing
- Precipitation gauge displays chance of precipitation as a percentage, and adds a period or exclamation points to indicate increasing severity. A . indicates insignificant precipitation, ! indicates drizzle, !! indicates light precipitation, and !!! indicates moderate to severe precipitation. So, 45!! means that there is a 45 percent chance of light precipitation at some point in the next 24 hours, and 90. means that there is a 90 percent chance of insignificant precipitation.
- Active calories burned refers to the number of calories burned while active as measured by the Pebble watch. This does not include sedentary calories or calories that Pebble did not consider as part of a workout.

To use the weather complications, you will need a free Dark Sky API key, available from https://darksky.net/dev/register

- Various source code improvements

data.description:
Approssimazione mostra un orario approssimato. Il concetto di fondo è che l'ora esatta non esiste e che dunque è inutile stare tanto a menarsela. Per cui se dice che mancano dieci minuti alle sei, potrebbero essere le cinque e cinquanta, le cinque e quarantotto o le cinque e cinquantadue...
Se scuoti il polso o fai un tap deciso sull'orologio, si aggiorna, con tutto quel che ciò può comportare...
Ogni tanto si prende anche la libertà di suggerirti qualcosa o di non rispondere direttamente alla domanda che implicitamente rivolgi all'orologio.
Se avete qualche idea, scrivetemi!
Grazie a Douwe Maan, sono partito dal suo codice essendo a digiuno di C.
Se vi piace e volete incoraggiarmi, le donazioni sono bene accette (anche ovviamente un caffè!): le trovate nella pagina per la configurazione della watchface (che per altro non si può per adesso configurare...)

This watchface is only in Italian, so far: sorry about that, mates! 
Thanks to Douwe Maan, I've started from his code.

data.description:
A watchface for pebble time and pebble round that depicts the sun and the moon's position in the sky.

In order to calculate the Sun/Moon rise and set times location services will need to be enabled.

- At 0 degrees (left side of the watchface) the Sun/Moon is rising over the horizon.
- At 180 degrees (right side of the watchface) the Sun/Moon object is setting under the horizon.
- When the Sun/Moon is below the earth then it is below your horizon.

data.description:
27 july
option to disable pattern on analog screen
removed inner black circle
batt charging text same colour as scroll text


This came about while working on an update for my original "Ticker Time" watchface.  In the end I'd changed so much I've published it as a separate watchface.

If you give the watch a shake the analog face disappears and the time/date (as text) scrolls across the screen - then it switches back to analog mode.

The battery charge level is indicated by the central ring - it depletes as the charge level decreases.  When the watch is charging, the battery percent level shows in the middle, then disappears when not charging.  The battery ring changes to Red below 40%.

The settings page includes,

- change background colour (analog & text)
- change scrolling text colour
- change hour hand colour (and the small 12 dot)
- change second hand colour
- turn the animation on/off
- bluetooth vibe on/off
- seconds hand on/off

The watchface also supports the Pebble app built-in languages (ie. for the scrolling text).

changelog.release_notes: Hotfix for data source issues

/!\ Help needed! I've got a lot of requests for pebble classic and pebble time round versions, but I don't have the time. If anyone has any pebble.js skills, consider contributing to https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble

/!\ This is the watchface version of the app. For the watchapp with more interactivity, see https://apps.getpebble.com/en_US/application/5798e5b11482cdda2b0000c8

What's new:
- Night mode (Enable Backlight) in the settings menu enables the backlight when you lock onto a Pokemon. Best for night time pokemon hunting!
- Add a new setting to temporarily disable priority settings, for when you just want to catch 'em all.

Fixes:
- Vibrate when the active pokemon enters the alert range, not just on first appearance
- Fix search bar so it isn't terrible
- Fix undefined settings before first config

Optimisations:
- Optimised more pokemon sprites
Fix duplicate pokemon bug

This release includes an improved search interface, and the ability to lock the active pokemon.

Shake your watch to lock a pokemon, and shake again to release.

For full navigational features, check out the watchapp version of this release, which includes scrolling through pokemon, dismissing pokemon, and changing pokemon priority, available at https://apps.getpebble.com/en_US/application/5798e5b11482cdda2b0000c8

I'll be maintaining both versions, so feel free to decide which way you like to use it better. A battery saving mode and better alert presets is coming in a future version to make it more suitable for every-day use. I don't recommend installing both...

P.S PokeVision is currently down, make sure it's up before you report a bug with this release :)

First release!

See https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble for documentation.

Don't forget to set your team in the watchface settings!

NOTE: If your watch does not show any pokemon, the pokemon go servers may be down, you may have no pokemon in your area or your GPS location could not be determined.

The compass is relative to north. For the best experience, align your Pokemon Go map to north and track down those Pokemon!

data.description:
PokeStop Timer for Pokemon Go - Never miss your Pokemon loot!

If you are looting a PokeStop you have to wait 5 minutes (or 300 seconds) to loot it again. This watchface will help you get all the loots you deserve.

With PokeStop Timer you won‘t miss out on a loot anymore. When you activate the PokeStop watchface, a 5 minute countdown will start in an endless loop of 5 minute countdowns. After every 300 seconds your Pebble will vibrate and you can loot your PokeStop again. If you are running out of sync with the timer or you just want to reset it „manually“, press the menu button (middle button = the button on the right site) followed by the back button (back button = the button on the left side) of the watchface. This is also known as „to the menu and back – Move“.

When you are in a bar with friends and want to really loot a Pokemon Go PokeStop, just let your Pebble remind you.

********************************

Nachdem Ihr euch bei einem PokeStop in Pokemon Go die Belohnungen holt, müsst Ihr 5 Minuten (oder 300 Sekunden) warten bis Ihr wieder Pokebälle, Heilsprays, Eier, etc. bekommen.

Mit diesem Pokemon Go Watchface verpasst Ihr keine Runde mehr. Startet das Watchface und ein Countdown zählt die 5 Minuten (oder 300 Sekunden) bis zur nächsten Pokemon Lootrunde herunten. Bei Null angekommen werdet Ihr durch eine Vibration Eurer Pebble darauf hingewiesen dass es wieder Zeit für Euren PokeStop ist.

Falls Ihr den Countdown neu starten wollt oder die Zeitdifferenz zu groß geworden ist, könnt Ihr dass indem Ihr den rechten mittleren Knopf und dann den linken Knopf betätigt (

data.description:
A simple watchface for daily use, with weather.

Features:
 - 12/24 hour clock
 - UK/US format date
 - battery percentage and coloured status, including charging
 - Bluetooth indicator with optional vibrate on loss of connection
 - Weather, with current condition and temperature, daily high/low temperature (coloured ranges), last updated
 - Celsius/Fahrenheit toggle
 - frequency of automated updates, including off
 - background is blue during the day, black at night and red at sunset/sunrise
 - weather/sunrise/sunset is stored, so even if connection is lost it is still presented (indicated as "N/C" for internet loss).
 - location is manually entered as lat/long so you don't need to rely on the phone establishing location
 - Dark Sky weather API key is limited to 1000 a day - so there is an option to enter your own, created on https://developer.forecast.io/

data.description:
Perpetual is a watchface that displays the time, date, month and the weekday in an analogue fashion.

The hour hand is red, and the minute hand is white. The 6 markers are ten minute markers.

In between the 12 o'clock mark and the 2 o'clock  mark is the AM/PM indicator. The dot is white during the AM and turns black in the PM.

The Date is represented by a red circle which resides on the outer ring of 30 + 1 circles. The 10-minute markers make it easier to read the date. For example the marker on the 30th minute indicates the 15th of the month (30÷2=15).

The Month resides as a red dot in the central ring. The dot's position on the dial represents the current month. For example, if the dot is on the 6th hour, the month is June. At 2 o'clock the date would be February. At 12 o'clock, its December.

The Day of the Week resides at the lower half of the circle as black dots. The current day of the week is represented by a red dot. It starts at the second marker (20 minutes) at Sunday. At the 6th hour mark, it would be Wednesday. On the 8th hour mark it would be Saturday.

The watch will vibrate (long-long-short) when bluetooth is disconnected. Or you can disable that behaviour.

Make it yours by customizing every color or choose from one of the defined themes.
You can also use a metal texture style of the background color.

Screenshot examples:
1) Monday, March 31, 11:25 PM
2) Monday, September 1, 3:00 AM
3) Wednesday, November 20, 5:25 AM
4) Saturday, July 23, 12:00 AM

The design is inspired by Ludwig Oechslin's Perpetual Calendar.

data.description:
Hexagon-based analog watchface
- clear outer hexagon (with smaller hexagon in it) showing the hour
- the central hexagon shows "PM" from 12:00
- hand from the large central hexagon leads to the 5-minute value
- 4 hexagons either side of the central one clear to indicate additional minutes with optional number
- floating hand leads to the last 5-second value
- Bluetooth indicator
- Battery level indicator

Some people might prefer the 5-minute hand to be thicker, so that's configurable

The 5-second hand can be switched off to conserve battery

Color configuration for:
- Background
- Highlight (5-minute, inner hour, Bluetooth & battery)
- 5-second hand (if enabled)

Note that when Quick Views occur, the 0, 5, 30 & 35 numbers are squashed up against the hexagons until the Quick View is over.  This has been done to avoid reducing the size of the display (and the resulting reduction in visibility).


Screenshots:
(1)  3:34:45PM
(2)  2:42:10PM (no minute text)
(3)  6:00PM (no seconds) 
(4)  7:15:00PM (thick 5-min hand)
(5)  7:29:45PM (with Quick View)


Designed by Peter Fletcher, who has designed watches for Tokyoflash and a number of the faces I have published. The watchface is published with his permission.
